newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: PENROSE LISTING TO BE REINSTATED ON JSE.
newsitem.headline: PENROSE LISTING TO BE REINSTATED ON JSE.

text.p: South Africa's Penrose Holdings Ltd said its listing would be re-instated on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange (JSE) on Monday.

The group, which is now involved in the printing, publishing and distribution of newspapers, and reproductions and four colour separations, said it would list 175.42 million shares of 10 cents each on the media sector of the JSE.
It said the share capital of the company was consolidated on a one-for-five basis and 99 million Penrose shares were issued to CTP Holdings Ltd to capitalise the loan of 9.9 million rand.

As part of the plans to restore its listing, Penrose said earlier that it would buy a number of regional newspaper publishing businesses for 75.6 million rand to be settled by the issue of 756.38 million new Penrose shares.
